intro: Apuleja heterophylla, commonly known as the variable leaf apuleja, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that vary in shape and size, adapting to different environmental conditions. It produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in late spring or early summer. Apuleja heterophylla is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is well adapted to arid or semi-arid climates.
